sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Lévy C curve.
message_1: What is the length of the Lévy C curve after three iterations if the original curve has a length of 1?
message_2:
The Lévy C curve is a self-replicating fractal. After each iteration, the length of the curve increases by a factor of √2. 

After three iterations, the length of the curve will be:

Original length × (√2)^3

1 × (√2)^3 = 1 × 2^(3/2) = 1 × 2^(1.5) ≈ 2.828

So, the length of the Lévy C curve after three iterations is approximately 2.828.
